result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur Marques Kennedy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arthur Marques Kennedy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Arthur Marques Kennedy.  Attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Saavedra. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12. 

*Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Arthur Marques Kennedy not in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Arthur Marques Kennedy.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense makes first appearance.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Arthur Marques Kennedy not in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for State v Lee Hearing this date.  No appearance by the Public Defender's Office, and no appointment has been done.  Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to the Court requesting the Court order the District Attorney's to provide victim/witness names received and filed.  bm
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Arthur Marques Kennedy appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to the Court regarding conflict check information received and filed.  bm
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Arthur Marques Kennedy appeared by video, in custody Waupun Correctional.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Arthur Marques Kennedy.  Attorney Samuel Tabin appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
